\hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1Image32}{}\doxysection{gft\+::Image32 Namespace Reference}
\label{namespacegft_1_1Image32}\index{gft::Image32@{gft::Image32}}

\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Common definitions and functions to manipulate a grayscale image of 32 bits per pixel.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1Image32_a0eadab27d946867a4d256cd470193422}\label{namespacegft_1_1Image32_a0eadab27d946867a4d256cd470193422}} 
\index{gft::Image32@{gft::Image32}!Complement@{Complement}}
\index{Complement@{Complement}!gft::Image32@{gft::Image32}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Complement()}{Complement()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1Image32_1_1sImage32}{s\+Image32}} $\ast$ gft\+::\+Image32\+::\+Complement (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1Image32_1_1sImage32}{s\+Image32}} $\ast$}]{img }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Calculates the image complement by inverting its values (white becomes black, black becomes white). 

In the complement of a grayscale image, each pixel value is subtracted from the maximum pixel value. The difference is used as the pixel value in the output image. In the output image, dark areas become lighter and light areas become darker. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1Image32_ae296ee7fa5602a6ce8061fda6c014f43}\label{namespacegft_1_1Image32_ae296ee7fa5602a6ce8061fda6c014f43}}
